rules.natural: If the findings report is submitted for publication, then it will be peer-reviewed.
Given that Dr. Smith is assigned as the editor for the findings report, the report is copy-edited.
Should revisions be requested for the findings report, then the publication is accepted.
Either the field season for Site Alpha is extended, or if Dr. Smith is assigned as the editor for the findings report then revisions are requested for it.
The museum is notified about the ceremonial mask only if its dating results have been published.
The excavation at Site Alpha is successful provided that Site Beta has pottery shards.
Provided that a sieve is available at Site Beta, a brush is also available there.

Either a legal challenge is filed regarding Site Beta, or if it is not the case that (the lack of a trowel implies a lack of a sieve) leads to an excavation halt, then the permit for Site Beta is revoked.
If a survey has been conducted at Site Alpha, then Site Alpha is in the Protected Valley region.
A survey has been conducted at Site Alpha, or a survey has been conducted at Site Beta.
The survey for Site Beta being rejected implies that the survey for Site Alpha is also rejected.
If Site Alpha has the standard excavation protocol, then should a survey at Site Beta not imply it is in the Protected Valley, the survey for Site Beta is rejected.
The dig has commenced at Site Alpha, or the dig has commenced at Site Beta.
The dig commences at Site Beta only if Site Beta is in the Protected Valley region.
Dr. Jones being the team lead for Site Alpha implies that Ms. Chen is the supervisor for Site Alpha.
Dr. Jones is the team lead for Site Alpha, or Dr. Jones is the team lead for Site Beta.
If Dr. Jones is the team lead for Site Beta, then the dig commencing at Site Alpha means Site Alpha is in the Protected Valley region.
Ms. Chen being the supervisor for Site Alpha implies she is also the supervisor for Site Beta.
Should Ms. Chen be the supervisor for Site Beta, then the dig commencing at Site Alpha implies Site Alpha is in the Protected Valley region.
A permit has been applied for Site Alpha, or a permit has been applied for Site Beta.
Site Alpha being in the Protected Valley region means a ground-penetrating radar is available there.
Under the condition that a permit is applied for Site Beta, the condition of stable strata is met at Site Beta.
If research from Site Alpha is submitted to the Journal of Archaeology, then a permit application for Site Alpha implies the stable strata condition is met there.
Research from Site Beta being submitted to the Journal of Archaeology implies that research from Site Alpha is also submitted there.
The ceremonial mask being missing implies that the findings report is not rejected for publication.
The findings report being typeset implies it is accepted for publication.
Site Beta being in the Protected Valley region implies excavation is not permitted there.
The condition of stable strata being met at Site Alpha implies it is in the Protected Valley region.
Under the condition that stable strata are met at Site Beta, Site Beta is in the Protected Valley region.
Funding being secured for Site Alpha implies that either the stable strata condition is met at Site Alpha or it is met at Site Beta.
Funding is secured for Site Alpha, or funding is secured for Site Beta.
If funding is secured for Site Beta, then the stable strata condition is met at Site Alpha or at Site Beta.
If it is not the case that having obsidian at Site Alpha implies a successful excavation there, then excavation is permitted at Site Beta.
Provided that it is not the case that the submission of the findings report implies it is not peer-reviewed, Dr. Smith is assigned as its editor.
If it is not true that Dr. Smith being assigned as editor implies revisions are requested, then the findings report is rejected for publication.
Under the condition that it is false that a mask discovery at Site Beta implies no discovery at Site Alpha, carbon dating is performed on the mask.
Whenever it is not the case that copy-editing the findings report implies it is typeset, printing of the report is scheduled.
If it is not true that copy-editing the report implies it is typeset, then printing is not scheduled for the report.
If it is not true that (the falsity of a mask discovery at Site Beta implying no discovery at Site Alpha) implies carbon dating was not performed, then the museum is notified about the mask.

Under the condition that it is false that (the falsity of a mask discovery at Site Beta implying no discovery at Site Alpha) implies carbon dating was not performed, the dating results for the mask are not published.
Provided that it is not the case that (the falsity of a trowel malfunction implying no trowel availability) implies a replacement was ordered, the replacement trowel arrives.
If it is not true that (the falsity of a trowel malfunction implying no trowel availability) implies a replacement was ordered, then the replacement trowel does not arrive.
Site Beta not having pottery shards implies a trowel is available at Site Beta.
The excavation at Site Alpha not being successful implies the findings report is submitted for publication.
Should the excavation at Site Alpha not be successful, then a ceremonial mask artifact is discovered at Site Alpha.
Under the condition that the excavation at Site Alpha is not successful, a ceremonial mask artifact is discovered at Site Beta.
